qas.question: What dynamic needs were the reason for building to be done?
Oral traditions allowed what to become formalized in human cultures?
What was the most valued type of building craft called?
Aside from skills, what is required in order to have the means for building?
What dynamic needs were the reason for building to be demolished?
Oral traditions disallowed what to become formalized in human cultures?
What was the least valued type of building craft called?
Aside from skills, what is not required in order to have the means for building?

context: Building first evolved out of the dynamics between needs (<a0_0><b5_0>shelter, security, worship<b5_0/><a0_0/>, etc.) and means (available <a4_0><b9_0>building materials<b9_0/><a4_0/> and attendant skills). As human cultures developed and <a1_0><b6_0>knowledge<b6_0/><a1_0/> began to be formalized through oral traditions and practices, building became <a2_0><b7_0>a craft<b7_0/><a2_0/>, and "<a3_0><b8_0>architecture<b8_0/><a3_0/>" is the name given to the most highly formalized and respected versions of that craft.
